info.title: nFusion Solutions Market Data API v1
info.description: nFusion Solutions provides REST and streaming APIs that deliver enterprise-grade financial data. Data sets include real-time and historical pricing for Spot prices of precious metals such as Gold, Silver, Platinum, and Palladium, exchange rates for major currency pairs, exchange rates for Crypto Currencies such as BTC, ETH, and LTC. All API access requires authentication. In order to be issued access credentials you must first enter into a service agreement with nFusion Solutions and acquire a commercial license. For information on how to obtain a licence contact sales@nfusionsolutions.com.

get.summary: Get list of currencies supported by the rate endpoint
get.description:
Any of the currencies in this list can be paired with any other currency in this list when supplied to the Rate endpoint.
For example: USD/CAD,CAD/USD,USD/EUR,EUR/CAD

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: auth token

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: to override content negotiation specify a value of json or xml

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The requested API version

get.summary: Get list of currency pairs supported by the Summary endpoint
get.description:
Only the currency pairs in the direction noted can be used with the Summary endpoint.
For example: USD/CAD is not the same as CAD/USD

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: auth token

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: to override content negotiation specify a value of json or xml

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The requested API version

get.summary: Get historical prices for requested currency pairs
get.description:
Historical OHLC data for the specified period and interval size

The combination of the interval parameter and start and end dates can result in results
being truncated to conform to result size limits. See comments on interval parameter for details on valid interval values.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: auth token

parameters.name: pairs
parameters.description: comma separated list of currency pairs. For example: USD/CAD,USD/EUR,USD/AUD

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: start date of time period. format is yyyy-mm-dd

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: end date of time period. format is yyyy-mm-dd. Default is current date.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description:
aggregation interval. Composed of an optional integer value (which defaults to 1 when not specified), 
followed by a type string which must be one of the following values:
y=year,
m=month,
w=week,
d=day,
h=hour,
mi=minute

For example, a yearly interval can be specified as "y" and 6 month interval as "6m". 

If not specified the interval parameter default is 1 Day.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: to override content negotiation specify a value of json or xml

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The requested API version

get.summary: Get latest Spot Summary for requested metals
get.description: Current and daily summary information combined into a single quote

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: auth token

parameters.name: metals
parameters.description: comma separated list of metals

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: comma separated list of conversion currencies, defaults to USD

parameters.name: unitofmeasure
parameters.description:
unit of meaure, defaults to troy ounces. allowed values are:
mg=milligram
g=gram
kg=kilogram
gr=grain
oz=ounce
toz=troy ounce
ct=carat
dwt=pennyweight

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: to override content negotiation specify a value of json or xml

parameters.name: adjust
parameters.description: apply global and per-tenant spot price adjustments. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The requested API version

get.summary: Get historical Spot prices for requested metals
get.description:
Historical OHLC data for the specified period and interval size

The combination of the interval parameter and start and end dates can result in results
being truncated to conform to result size limits. See comments on interval parameter for details on valid interval values.

The historicalfx flag is used to determine whether to apply today's fx rates to a historical period, or to apply the historical rates from that same time frame.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: auth token

parameters.name: metals
parameters.description: comma separated list of metals

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: start date of time period. format is yyyy-mm-dd

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: end date of time period. format is yyyy-mm-dd. Default is current date.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description:
aggregation interval. Composed of an optional integer value (which defaults to 1 when not specified), 
followed by a type string which must be one of the following values:
y=year,
m=month,
w=week,
d=day,
h=hour,
mi=minute

For example, a yearly interval can be specified as "y" and 6 month interval as "6m". 

If not specified the interval parameter default is 1 Day.

parameters.name: historicalfx
parameters.description: if true use historical currency rates otherwise current currency rates. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: comma separated list of conversion currencies, defaults to USD

parameters.name: unitofmeasure
parameters.description:
unit of meaure, defaults to troy ounces. allowed values are:
mg=milligram
g=gram
kg=kilogram
gr=grain
oz=ounce
toz=troy ounce
ct=carat
dwt=pennyweight

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: to override content negotiation specify a value of json or xml

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The requested API version
